comments:
Pressing the save button would not do anything.  I closed the file and clicked yes to save.  Still, when I reopened the file it had the * on it as if it required saving.  This is what I saw in the log;

I have never seen this problem before.  My workspace is on the C: drive, my project is on the G: drive (flash) my bin folder is on the C: drive.  The folder on the C: drive is encrypted, but again, I have been doing this for a long time now with no problems, and I don't really expect to see this one again.  Just reporting in case it clues anyone into something.  Otherwise you are welcome to close, if you think its a fluke caused by the planets aligning.
I forgot to note that the changed file did actually save.

The exception traces seem unrelated - they occur during a build.  Was there any other error that occurred during editor save? If it's not reproducible and there isn't a related error in the log, there's not much to go on here.

I guess I'll have to close it then.  No, there was no exception during save.  I thought it odd myself.  I pushed the save button and nothing happened.  usually when nothing happens its because there are exceptions being thrown that you don't see.  However, when I opened the log, there were no exceptions going into in on the push.  This build error seemed to spawn the error in saving, but there is no record of the error in saving.

To be fair, there was actually no error in saving since the file was properly updated.  The only error appears to be that the * was not removed when the file was made clean through saving.  And, more strangely, the * came back when I reopened the file.

This is happening again.  I am using 3.1.2.  This is what I did;

I am adding public to a bunch of methods in a certain package.  

1. I selected all the classes in this package and right click then chose open.
2. starting from the top, double click the file (which selects it in the editor).
3. starting from top of file, scroll down, paste in "public ". scroll some more, paste again.
4. push save.  Then go to next file.

I guess im pushing close sometimes as well.

this worked for about 4-5 files, but has failed on 2.  but not back to back.

These files have the change * but it wont save.  No errors are thrown.  refreshing workspace does nothing.  I can undo/redo and the * will come and go.  I can save other files, but these stay so they wont save.  There are java errors in the file as well.

I can double click in the project view which causes the file to be selected in the editor view.  Still cant save.  Its basically like the save function is detached from the editor some how.  The action is there because if i undo/redo the save button will enable/disable.

I just clicked to close one of the files.  It opens the save changes dialog.  I select to save, but the changes are just discarded.  So the button does not work, and the saving when the editor is closed also does not work.  Reopening the file and editing it now saves the contents properly.

This time i right clicked the other file that was not saving and selected "open with text editor."  It opened automatically with the *.  I pushed save, and now its saved for both editors.  I can make a change and both editors will realize the file needs saving.  But the one editor still wont save the file.  Also eventhough it lost the * and disabled the save button, the error icon is still present in the java editor.


This could be related to the rapid opening of so many files at once by shift-clicking them.

Can you enter a new bug against Platform UI for this recent problem? I would move this bug there, but it may be confused by the log messages that seem to be unrelated.  Just paste your latest comment into a new bug in Platform UI please.
